metadata.title: CVE-2022-21824 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Due to the formatting logic of the "console.table()" function it was notsafe to allow user controlled input to be passed to the "properties"parameter while simultaneously passing a plain object with at least oneproperty as the first parameter, which could be "__proto__". The prototypepollution has very limited control, in that it only allows an empty stringto be assigned to numerical keys of the object prototype.Node.js >=12.22.9, >= 14.18.3, >= 16.13.2, and >= 17.3.1 use a null protoype for theobject these properties are being assigned to.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
nodejs - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2').
